intro: Laetia completa, commonly known as the golden cupplant, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its distinctive golden-yellow flowers that bloom in late summer and early fall. The plant has a stout, upright stem with large, heart-shaped leaves that are often hairy. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks. Laetia completa is an important plant for pollinators and is considered a valuable addition to native plant gardens.
